conclusion: To find the magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab, we need to consider the forces acting on the system.
Figure 3 shows a wooden block P sliding on a long wooden board ab, which is placed on a horizontal ground.
The board ab remains stationary all the time.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between the board ab and the ground is μ1, and between the block P and the board ab is μ2.
Block P has mass m and board ab has mass M.
Weight of the Block P is mg downward.
Normal Force from ab is N upward, balancing the weight of P, so N = mg.
Kinetic Frictional Force on P is f_k = μ2 N = μ2 mg acting to the left.
Weight of the Board ab is Mg downward.
Normal Force from the Ground is Ng = (M + m)g upward, balancing the total weight.
Frictional Force on ab due to P is f1 = μ2 mg acting to the right.
Frictional Force from the Ground is f2 acting to the left to balance the forces.
Since the board ab remains stationary, the net force on it must be zero.
The frictional force from the ground f2 must balance the frictional force f1 due to P.
From equilibrium of forces on ab, f2 = f1.
The magnitude of the frictional force exerted by the ground on the long wooden board ab is μ2 mg.
